Award Type: PROJECT GRANT (B)

Award Type: COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT (B)
Description: FOODAPS ESSEX - RANGELAND ECOSYSTEM DYSFUNCTION ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED WILDFIRE ACTIVITY, INVASIVE ANNUAL GRASSES, AND EXPANDING CONIFERS IS NEGATIVELY IMPACTING AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION AND A VARIETY OF ECOSYSTEM SERVICES ACROSS THE WESTERN UNITED STATES. THESE FACTORS HAVE SEVERE ECONOMIC IMPLICATIONS; FOR EXAMPLE, FEDERAL FIRE SUPPRESSION EXPENDITURES IN FY 2017 APPROACHED $3 BILLION. THE INCREASING FREQUENCY OF WILDFIRES ACROSS WESTERN RANGELANDS REMAINS A THREAT TO ECOSYSTEM STRUCTURE AND FUNCTION. IN GREAT BASIN RANGELANDS, WILDFIRE OFTEN CREATES A POSITIVE FEEDBACK BY INCREASING INVASIVE ANNUALS AND ALTERING FUEL LOADING. UNDERSTANDING THE DYNAMICS OF THE PLANT COMMUNITY-BOTH IN RESPONSE TO WILDFIRE AND ITS ROLE IN WILDFIRE OCCURRENCE-IS CRITICAL TO GUIDE RANGELAND MANAGEMENT IN THE FACE OF FIRE, FUELS, AND INVASIVE PLANTS. AT LARGE SPATIAL SCALES, EXISTING FUEL MODELING EFFORTS HAVE SHOWN THAT ANTECEDENT PRECIPITATION AMOUNT AND PATTERN CAN BE USED TO GENERALIZE WILDFIRE PROBABILITY. MISSING FROM THOSE EFFORTS HAS BEEN THE INCORPORATION OF BIOTIC STATUS (E.G., PLANT COMMUNITY COMPOSITION AND FUNCTIONAL GROUP ABUNDANCE) INTO PREDICTIVE MODELS. INCORPORATING CURRENT BIOTIC INFORMATION HAS THE POTENTIAL TO DRAMATICALLY IMPROVE THE RELEVANCY OF EMPIRICALLY-DERIVED MODELS TO ON-THE-GROUND MANAGEMENT CONDITIONS AND DECISION MAKING. THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS WORK ARE TO 1) EXAMINE THE BIOTIC DRIVERS OF AND RESPONSES TO WILDFIRE; AND 2) EXAMINE THE POTENTIAL FOR INCORPORATING BIOTIC COMPONENTS INTO ABIOTICALLY-DRIVEN (E.G., PRECIPITATION AT VARIOUS TIME LAGS) MODELS FOR PREDICTING WILDFIRE AND PLANT COMMUNITY RESPONSES. OBJECTIVES WILL APPLY ACROSS THE GREAT BASIN REGION.

Award Type: COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT (B)
Description: 25 YEARS OF FOOD SECURITY MEASUREMENT: ANSWERED QUESTIONS AND FURTHER RESEARCH - PREVIOUS WORK HAS IDENTIFIED MOST (OR ALL) OF THE EFFECTORS THAT PSEUDOMONAS SYRINGAE STRAIN DC3000 USES TO DISABLE PLANT DEFENSES AND MANY OF THE COMPONENTS IN THE PLANT DEFENSE SYSTEMS THAT ARE TARGETED BY THE EFFECTORS. HOWEVER, IT IS STILL RELATIVELY UNKNOWN WHICH COMPONENTS OF THE PLANT ENVIRONMENT TRIGGER THE BACTERIA TO DEPLOY ITS VIRULENCE SYSTEMS, OR HOW THE BACTERIA SENSES AND RESPONDS TO PLANT DEFENSES WHEN THEY ARE DEPLOYED. THIS AGREEMENT PROPOSES TO IDENTIFY THE SIGNAL RECEPTORS AND REGULATION PATHWAYS THAT DC3000 USES TO SURVIVE WITHIN THE PLANT ENVIRONMENT.

PROJECT 2 - MALE STERILE FACILITATED RECURRENT SELECTION FOR FHB RESISTANCE (MPI-5): THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ADVANCE MALE-STERILE FACILITATED RECURRENT SELECTION POPULATIONS THAT HAVE BEEN DEVELOPED TO COMBINE GENES FOR FHB RESISTANCE FROM MULTIPLE SOURCES IN SOFT WINTER WHEAT BACKGROUNDS ADAPTED TO THE EASTERN U.S. PROJECT 3 - COORDINATED PHENOTYPING OF UNIFORM NURSERIES AND OFFICIAL VARIETY TRIALS: SCREEN AND EVALUATE APPROX. 450 UNIQUE ADVANCED BREEDING LINES AND RELEASED CULTIVARS FOR FHB RESISTANCE. PROJECT 4 - IMPLEMENTING GENOMIC SELECTION FOR FHB RESISTANCE IN SOFT WINTER WHEAT (SWW) ADAPTED TO THE CORN BELT: 1) TO IMPLEMENT GENOMIC SELECTION (GS) FOR FHB RESISTANCE IN SOFT WINTER WHEAT BY COMPLETING TWO CYCLES OF GS; AND 2) INITIATE EVALUATION OF THE EFFECTIVENESS OF GS.

Description: PANEL PRICE INDICES AND PRICE PREMIA FOR ORGANIC FRESH FRUITS & VEGETABLES - DEVELOP PREDICTIVE MODELING TOOLS FOR NORTHERN CORN LEAF BLIGHT (NCLB) AND GRAY LEAF SPOT (GLS) OF CORN. FOR COTTON, THE FIRST OBJECTIVE IS TO CREATE DNA DETECTION TOOLS FOR COTTON PATHOGENS THAT CAN BE MULTIPLEXED AND DEPLOYED IN AIR SAMPLING SYSTEMS. THE SECOND OBJECTIVE IS TO ESTABLISH THE ASSOCIATION BETWEEN INITIAL INOCULUM, DISEASE DEVELOPMENT AND WEATHER IN SENTINEL PLOTS TO BUILD AND VALIDATE PATHOGEN MODELS. THE THIRD OBJECTIVE IS TO INSTALL PASSIVE AIR SAMPLERS IN COMMERCIAL COTTON FIELDS LOCATED NEAR THE SENTINEL PLOTS AND CAPTURE DAILY WEATHER DATA. THE FOURTH OBJECTIVE IS TO CREATE A COTTON YIELD EPIDEMIOLOGY MODEL FOR TARGET SPOT BASED ON DISEASE PROGRESS AND PATHOGEN LOAD. THE FIFTH OBJECTIVE IS TO ARCHIVE ALL DATA, MODELS, AND SAMPLES FROM THE PREVIOUS OBJECTIVES TO ALLOW FUTURE INVESTIGATORS TO IMPROVE MODELS AND TOOLS AND TO RETROSPECTIVELY IDENTIFY INVASIVE PATHOGENS OR VIRULENT STRAINS.

Award Type: OTHER REIMBURSABLE, CONTINGENT, INTANGIBLE, OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE
Description: UNDERSTANDING SNAP AND FOOD SECURITY AMONG LOW-INCOME HOUSEHOLDS - INFECTIONS WITH HERPES VIRUSES ARE KNOWN TO GENERATE POWERFUL CD8 T CELL RESPONSES AND THERE IS A LARGE BODY OF EVIDENCE INDICATING THAT THESE RESPONSES PLAY A KEY ROLE IN IMMUNITY TO THESE VIRUSES. THIS HAS PROMPTED RESEARCH TO EXPLORE THE POTENTIAL OF CERTAIN HERPES VIRUSES AS VACCINE VECTORS, FOCUSING PARTICULARLY ON DISEASES THAT REQUIRE CD8 T CELL RESPONSES FOR IMMUNITY. THE CAPACITY OF CD8 T CELLS TO ACT AS EFFECTORS AGAINST VIRAL INFECTIONS GENERALLY RELIES ON THEIR ABILITY TO RECOGNISE AND RESPOND TO VIRUS-INFECTED CELLS BEFORE THEY PRODUCE LARGE QUANTITIES OF VIRUS. IN THIS REGARD, CD8 T CELL RESPONSES TO HERPES VIRUSES SUCH AS HUMAN HERPES SIMPLEX VIRUS (HSV-1) TEND TO INCLUDE DOMINANT RESPONSES AGAINST THE IE PROTEINS AND IT IS THESE RESPONSES THAT ARE PREDOMINANTLY INVOLVED IN MEDIATING IMMUNE PROTECTION. IN ADDITION, A NUMBER OF HERPES VIRUSES HAVE A PREFERENTIAL TROPISM FOR MACROPHAGES AND DENDRITIC CELLS, THUS ENABLING THE INFECTED CELLS THEMSELVES TO ACT AS ANTIGEN-PRESENTING CELLS FOR INDUCTION OF CD8 T CELL RESPONSES. ONE SUCH GROUP IS THE CYTOMEGALOVIRUSES (CMV), WHICH IN HUMANS CAUSE ASYMPTOMATIC INFECTIONS IN HEALTHY PEOPLE BUT CAN BE PATHOGENIC IN IMMUNOCOMPROMISED INDIVIDUALS. MOREOVER, SINCE CMVS ARE POOR INDUCERS OF NEUTRALISING ANTIBODIES, A CD8 T CELL RESPONSE CAN STILL BE INDUCED FOLLOWING IMMUNIZATION OF PREVIOUSLY INFECTED INDIVIDUALS. THE COMBINATION OF THESE PROPERTIES MAKES CMVS AN ATTRACTIVE PROSPECT FOR USE AS VACCINE VECTORS. RECENT STUDIES UTILISING SIMIAN CMV AS A VECTOR FOR DELIVERY OF SIMIAN IMMUNODEFICIENCY VIRAL ANTIGENS HAVE SHOWN THAT IT INDUCES STRONG VIRUS-SPECIFIC CD8 T CELL RESPONSES AND HIGH LEVELS OF PROTECTION AGAINST VIRUS CHALLENGE. ALTHOUGH A CYTOMEGALOVIRUS HAS NOT BEEN IDENTIFIED IN CATTLE, BOVINE HERPES VIRUS 4 (BHV-4) SHARES A NUMBER OF PROPERTIES WITH CYTOMEGALOVIRUSES, WHICH HIGHLIGHT ITS POTENTIAL AS A VECTOR. ORIGINALLY CLASSIFIED AS A B-HERPES VIRUS AND REFERRED TO AS BOVINE CYTOMEGALOVIRUS, BASED ON ITS BIOLOGICAL PROPERTIES, BHV-4 WAS SUBSEQUENTLY FOUND TO BE A '-HERPES VIRUS. INFECTION WITH BHV-4 IS PREVALENT IN EUROPE AND USA AND ALTHOUGH THE VIRUS HAS BEEN ISOLATED FREQUENTLY FROM BOTH NORMAL AND DISEASED BOVINE TISSUES, THERE IS CURRENTLY NO EVIDENCE THAT IT IS THE CAUSATIVE AGENT OF DISEASE. LIKE CYTOMEGALOVIRUSES, BHV-4 IS REPORTED TO HAVE A PREDILECTION FOR THE MACROPHAGE LINEAGE AND IT INDUCES POOR NEUTRALIZING ANTIBODY RESPONSES. HENCE, IT IS LIKELY TO GENERATE CELLULAR IMMUNE RESPONSES IN PREVIOUSLY INFECTED ANIMALS AND COULD POTENTIALLY BE ADMINISTERED ON MORE THAN ONE OCCASION TO BOOST CELLULAR IMMUNE RESPONSES. BHV-4 HAS BEEN DEVELOPED AS A VACCINE VECTOR BY DR. GAITANO DONOFRIA, WHO HAS PRODUCED SEVERAL RECOMBINANT BHV-4 VIRUSES EXPRESSING VIRAL PROTEINS AND SHOWN THAT THEY STIMULATE STRONG ANTIBODY RESPONSES IN CALVES AND PROTECTION AGAINST THE RESPECTIVE VIRUSES. HOWEVER, THE ABILITY OF THE VIRUS TO INDUCE CELLULAR IMMUNE RESPONSES HAS NOT BEEN INVESTIGATED.

Award Type: OTHER REIMBURSABLE, CONTINGENT, INTANGIBLE, OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE
Description: FOOD ENVIRONMENT DATA SYSTEM (FEDS) DATA PRODUCT - RANGELAND ECOSYSTEM DYSFUNCTION ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED WILDFIRE ACTIVITY, INVASIVE ANNUAL GRASSES, AND EXPANDING CONIFERS IS NEGATIVELY IMPACTING AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION AND A VARIETY OF ECOSYSTEM SERVICES ACROSS THE WESTERN UNITED STATES. THESE FACTORS HAVE SEVERE ECONOMIC IMPLICATIONS; FOR EXAMPLE, FEDERAL FIRE SUPPRESSION EXPENDITURES IN FY 2017 APPROACHED $3 BILLION. THE INCREASING FREQUENCY OF WILDFIRES ACROSS WESTERN RANGELANDS REMAINS A THREAT TO ECOSYSTEM STRUCTURE AND FUNCTION. IN GREAT BASIN RANGELANDS, WILDFIRE OFTEN CREATES A POSITIVE FEEDBACK BY INCREASING INVASIVE ANNUALS AND ALTERING FUEL LOADING. UNDERSTANDING THE DYNAMICS OF THE PLANT COMMUNITY-BOTH IN RESPONSE TO WILDFIRE AND ITS ROLE IN WILDFIRE OCCURRENCE-IS CRITICAL TO GUIDE RANGELAND MANAGEMENT IN THE FACE OF FIRE, FUELS, AND INVASIVE PLANTS. AT LARGE SPATIAL SCALES, EXISTING FUEL MODELING EFFORTS HAVE SHOWN THAT ANTECEDENT PRECIPITATION AMOUNT AND PATTERN CAN BE USED TO GENERALIZE WILDFIRE PROBABILITY. MISSING FROM THOSE EFFORTS HAS BEEN THE INCORPORATION OF BIOTIC STATUS (E.G., PLANT COMMUNITY COMPOSITION AND FUNCTIONAL GROUP ABUNDANCE) INTO PREDICTIVE MODELS. INCORPORATING CURRENT BIOTIC INFORMATION HAS THE POTENTIAL TO DRAMATICALLY IMPROVE THE RELEVANCY OF EMPIRICALLY-DERIVED MODELS TO ON-THE-GROUND MANAGEMENT CONDITIONS AND DECISION MAKING. THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS WORK ARE TO 1) EXAMINE THE BIOTIC DRIVERS OF AND RESPONSES TO WILDFIRE; AND 2) EXAMINE THE POTENTIAL FOR INCORPORATING BIOTIC COMPONENTS INTO ABIOTICALLY-DRIVEN (E.G., PRECIPITATION AT VARIOUS TIME LAGS) MODELS FOR PREDICTING WILDFIRE AND PLANT COMMUNITY RESPONSES. OBJECTIVES WILL APPLY ACROSS THE GREAT BASIN REGION.

Award Type: OTHER REIMBURSABLE, CONTINGENT, INTANGIBLE, OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE
Description: EXTRAMARGINAL SNAP PARTICIPANTS AND FOOD INSECURITY - THE UNIVERSITY OF GEORGIA RESEARCH FOUNDATION AND THE AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH SERVICE (ARS) DESIRE TO ENTER INTO THIS AGREEMENT FOR THE PURPOSE OF SUPPORTING RESEARCH TO BE CARRIED OUT AT ARS AND COOPERATOR FACILITIES. Description: FEDERAL NUTRITION ASSISTANCE, FOOD INSUFFICIENCY, AND HEALTH AND HEALTH CARE OUTCOMES AMONG HOUSEHOLDS WITH AND WITHOUT CHILDREN WITH SPECIA - OBTAIN AND ANALYZE GENE EXPRESSION DATA USING RNA SEQUENCING ON A SERIES OF OAT LINES THAT HAVE BEEN CHARACTERIZED FOR NUTRITIONAL QUALITY AND HAVE BEEN ASSAYED USING HIGH-THROUGHPUT METABOLOMICS OF MATURE GRAIN. THESE LINES HAVE ALSO BEEN GENOTYPED BY SEQUENCING REDUCED REPRESENTATIONS OF THEIR GENOMES. DIFFERENTIAL GENE EXPRESSION AND CORRELATION BETWEEN GENE EXPRESSION, METABOLOMICS PROFILES, AND NUTRITIONAL QUALITY WILL BE USED TO IDENTIFY LOCI HARBORING GENETIC VARIATION THAT AFFECTS NUTRITIONAL QUALITY. THESE DATA WILL ALSO ENABLE PREDICTION OF NUTRITIONAL QUALITY FOR NEWLY DEVELOPED OAT LINES.

Description: THE FILL-IN TRIP PURCHASE DECISION BY SNAP AND WIC PARTICIPANTS: AN ANALYSIS OF PRICING, NUTRITION, AND STORE CHOICES - TO DISCOVER AND CHARACTERIZE NATURAL ENEMIES OF THE INVASIVE ROSEAU CANE SCALE (RCS) AND DETERMINE THEIR NATURAL DISTRIBUTION RANGE IN ASIA, PARTICULARLY JAPAN; AND CHARACTERIZE THEIR ASSOCIATION WITH HOST PLANT GENOTYPE DIFFERENCES THAT MAY BE RELATED TO SCALE INSECT COLONIZATION SUCCESS. RCS IS NATIVE TO NE ASIA AND HAS BECOME INVASIVE ALONG THE US GULF COAST, CAUSING DIE-OFF OF ROSEAU CANE GRASS THAT PROTECTS AGAINST COASTAL EROSION AND SILTING OF NAVIGATION CHANNELS. ARS AND APHIS ARE COORDINATING EFFORTS WITH US AND ASIAN COOPERATORS TO FIND A BIOLOGICAL CONTROL SOLUTION THAT CAN HELP MANAGE THE INVASIVE SCALE.

Award Type: OTHER REIMBURSABLE, CONTINGENT, INTANGIBLE, OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE
Description: DO SUPERCENTERS EFFECT DIET QUALITY - INFECTIONS WITH HERPES VIRUSES ARE KNOWN TO GENERATE POWERFUL CD8 T CELL RESPONSES AND THERE IS A LARGE BODY OF EVIDENCE INDICATING THAT THESE RESPONSES PLAY A KEY ROLE IN IMMUNITY TO THESE VIRUSES. THIS HAS PROMPTED RESEARCH TO EXPLORE THE POTENTIAL OF CERTAIN HERPES VIRUSES AS VACCINE VECTORS, FOCUSING PARTICULARLY ON DISEASES THAT REQUIRE CD8 T CELL RESPONSES FOR IMMUNITY. THE CAPACITY OF CD8 T CELLS TO ACT AS EFFECTORS AGAINST VIRAL INFECTIONS GENERALLY RELIES ON THEIR ABILITY TO RECOGNISE AND RESPOND TO VIRUS-INFECTED CELLS BEFORE THEY PRODUCE LARGE QUANTITIES OF VIRUS. IN THIS REGARD, CD8 T CELL RESPONSES TO HERPES VIRUSES SUCH AS HUMAN HERPES SIMPLEX VIRUS (HSV-1) TEND TO INCLUDE DOMINANT RESPONSES AGAINST THE IE PROTEINS AND IT IS THESE RESPONSES THAT ARE PREDOMINANTLY INVOLVED IN MEDIATING IMMUNE PROTECTION. IN ADDITION, A NUMBER OF HERPES VIRUSES HAVE A PREFERENTIAL TROPISM FOR MACROPHAGES AND DENDRITIC CELLS, THUS ENABLING THE INFECTEDCELLS THEMSELVES TO ACT AS ANTIGEN-PRESENTING CELLS FOR INDUCTION OF CD8 T CELL RESPONSES. ONE SUCH GROUP IS THE CYTOMEGALOVIRUSES (CMV), WHICH IN HUMANS CAUSE ASYMPTOMATIC INFECTIONS IN HEALTHY PEOPLE BUT CAN BE PATHOGENIC IN IMMUNOCOMPROMISED INDIVIDUALS. MOREOVER, SINCE CMVS ARE POOR INDUCERS OF NEUTRALISING ANTIBODIES, A CD8 T CELL RESPONSE CAN STILL BE INDUCED FOLLOWING IMMUNIZATION OF PREVIOUSLY INFECTED INDIVIDUALS. THE COMBINATION OF THESE PROPERTIES MAKES CMVS AN ATTRACTIVE PROSPECT FOR USE AS VACCINE VECTORS. RECENT STUDIES UTILISING SIMIAN CMV AS A VECTOR FOR DELIVERY OF SIMIAN IMMUNODEFICIENCY VIRAL ANTIGENS HAVE SHOWN THAT IT INDUCES STRONG VIRUS-SPECIFIC CD8 T CELL RESPONSES AND HIGH LEVELS OF PROTECTION AGAINST VIRUS CHALLENGE. ALTHOUGH A CYTOMEGALOVIRUS HAS NOT BEEN IDENTIFIED IN CATTLE, BOVINE HERPES VIRUS 4 (BHV-4) SHARES A NUMBER OF PROPERTIES WITH CYTOMEGALOVIRUSES, WHICH HIGHLIGHT ITS POTENTIAL AS A VECTOR. ORIGINALLY CLASSIFIED AS A B-HERPES VIRUS AND REFERRED TO AS BOVINE CYTOMEGALOVIRUS, BASED ON ITS BIOLOGICAL PROPERTIES, BHV-4 WAS SUBSEQUENTLY FOUND TO BE A '-HERPES VIRUS. INFECTION WITH BHV-4 IS PREVALENT IN EUROPE AND USA AND ALTHOUGH THE VIRUS HAS BEEN ISOLATED FREQUENTLY FROM BOTH NORMAL AND DISEASED BOVINE TISSUES, THERE IS CURRENTLY NO EVIDENCE THAT IT IS THE CAUSATIVE AGENT OF DISEASE. LIKE CYTOMEGALOVIRUSES, BHV-4 IS REPORTED TO HAVE A PREDILECTION FOR THE MACROPHAGE LINEAGE AND IT INDUCES POOR NEUTRALIZING ANTIBODY RESPONSES. HENCE, IT IS LIKELY TO GENERATE CELLULAR IMMUNE RESPONSES IN PREVIOUSLY INFECTED ANIMALS AND COULD POTENTIALLY BE ADMINISTERED ON MORE THAN ONE OCCASION TO BOOST CELLULAR IMMUNE RESPONSES. BHV-4 HAS BEEN DEVELOPED AS A VACCINE VECTOR BY DR. GAITANO DONOFRIA, WHO HAS PRODUCED SEVERAL RECOMBINANT BHV-4 VIRUSES EXPRESSING VIRAL PROTEINS AND SHOWN THAT THEY STIMULATE STRONG ANTIBODY RESPONSES IN CALVES AND PROTECTION AGAINST THE RESPECTIVE VIRUSES. HOWEVER, THE ABILITY OF THE VIRUS TO INDUCE CELLULAR IMMUNE RESPONSES HAS NOT BEEN INVESTIGATED.

Award Type: OTHER REIMBURSABLE, CONTINGENT, INTANGIBLE, OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE
Description: HOUSEHOLD EXPENDITURES AT DOLLAR STORES AND IMPLICATIONS FOR HEALTH, 2008-18 - PREHARVEST AFLATOXIN CONTAMINATION OF COTTONSEED IS A MAJOR FOOD SAFETY PROBLEM BECAUSE COTTONSEED CAKES ARE FED TO CATTLE. AFLATOXIN CONTAMINATION OCCURS IN ARID AND SEMI-ARID TROPICS THAT INCLUDE THE COTTON BELT AND CORN GROWING AREAS IN THE USA AND THE PROBLEM IS EXACERBATED DURING DROUGHT CONDITIONS. IMPROVING THE HOST RESISTANCE OF COTTON PLANT TO RESIST INFECTION BY ASPERGILLUS FLAVUS, THE CAUSAL ORGANISM IS ONE OF THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES. TRANSGENIC EXPRESSION OF NATURALLY-OCCURRING OR SYNTHETIC PEPTIDES HAS BEEN SHOWN TO IMPART RESISTANCE TO ASPERGILLUS UNDER LABORATORY AND GREENHOUSE CONDITIONS. SYNTHETIC PEPTIDES ARE OFTEN RESISTANT TO PROTEOLYTIC DEGRADATION AND OFFER A GOOD BROAD-SPECTRUM CONTROL OF SEVERAL MICROBIAL PATHOGENS. WE HAVE SEVERAL TRANSGENIC COTTON LINES EXPRESSING SYNTHETIC OR NATURAL ANTIFUNGAL PEPTIDES OR PROTEINS IN PROGRESS. ONE PROMISING SYNTHETIC, LYTIC PEPTIDE IS D4E1 AND TRANSGENIC LINES ARE READY FOR FIELD TEST. THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS STUDY ARE MANIFOLD AND INCLUDE: 1) EVALUATE TRANSGENIC COTTON LINES (E.G. D4E1) FOR RESISTANCE TO ASPERGILLUS FLAVUS AND OTHER SEEDLING PATHOGENS (FUSARIUM, VERTICILLIUM) AND INSECT PESTS AS COMPARED TO AN ISOGENIC CONTROL LINE UNDER NORMAL FIELD CONDITIONS IN ARIZONA; 2) DETERMINE THE LEVEL OF PREHARVEST AFLATOXIN CONTAMINATION IN COTTONSEED AND IDENTIFY RESISTANT LINES; 3) EVALUATE AGRONOMIC PERFORMANCE OF TRANSGENIC LINES (YIELD, FIBER/SEED QUALITY) AS COMPARED TO CONTROL; AND 4) ASSESS POSSIBLE EFFECTS OF TRANSGENIC LINES ON DIVERSITY OF SOIL MICROBES AND OTHER NON-TARGET SPECIES.
